thread.title: Pep Guardiola claims critics will 'kill' Manchester City if they do not beat Monaco in the Champions League
thread.title_full: Pep Guardiola claims critics will 'kill' Manchester City if they do not beat Monaco in the Champions League

author: Andy Dunn
title: Pep Guardiola claims critics will 'kill' Manchester City if they do not beat Monaco in the Champions League
text:
Sport Pep Guardiola claims critics will 'kill' Manchester City if they do not beat Monaco in the Champions League Guardiola has never failed to reach a Champions League semi-final in seven attempts as a manager but faces a severe test in the last 16 from the French league leaders Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Pep Guardiola believes his Manchester City side will be ‘killed’ if they do not beat Monaco. 
Guardiola has never failed to reach a Champions League semi-final in seven attempts as a manager but faces a severe test in the last 16 from the French league leaders. 
And he knows the pressure is on big-spending City, who reached the semi-finals under Manuel Pellegrini last season. 
Guardiola said: “All of Europe will watch us. They will analyse us and kill us if we don’t win.” 
The City boss, though, insists he is revelling in the pressure, reminding the likes of Chelsea, Manchester United and Liverpool that they failed to even feature in this season’s competition. 
He said: “It is amazing to be here again. To be here is not easy. People can think with City, England, the most prestigious football, the most media, most advertising in the world, that you have to be here. Radamel Falcao has been in sensational form this season (Photo: Reuters) 
“But a lot of big clubs are not here. You have to live with that situation.” 
City face a formidable test against Monaco, who are three points clear of Paris St Germain in Ligue 1, scoring a staggering 76 goals in the process. 
Guardiola is well aware of the dangers posed by a rejuvenated Radamel Falcao and company. Manchester City manager Guardiola arrives (Photo: PA) 
As he prepared for the first leg at the Etihad, the City boss said: “It is the most successful team in Europe in terms of scoring goals. A tough draw. A complete team. I’m looking forward to playing against them, seeing how is our level. 
“They are physically strong and the two strikers, Falcao and (Valere) Germain are fighters, they are killers in the box.” 
Guardiola confirmed Vincent Kompany is not available and says he will make a decision on the goalkeeper on the morning of the game although it is almost certain Willy Caballero will get the nod. Like us on Facebook
